conflictDescription: User Story A requires separation of clinical and social data to focus on medical information, implying access to clinical data. User Story B requires manual control of client consent, which could forbid access to some data including clinical data. This creates a conflict between needing access to clinical data and possibly forbidding it via consent control.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to separate clinical data from social data so I can focus only on medical information during work and ignore non-medical details.
userStoryBSummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually control my clients' consent settings, so I can keep their privacy safe while caring for many clients.
